alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 9:43PM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT WESTERN KIMBALL...SOUTHWESTERN BANNER AND EAST CENTRAL LARAMIE COUNTIES... At 843 PM MST...An area of heavy snow was affecting portions of western Kimball...southwestern Banner and eastern Laramie Counties. Periods of heavy snowfall will persist through 1015 PM MST. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 25 mph and visibilities less than one mile. SOURCE...Radar and Webcams. IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions due to slick roads and low visibilities. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluffs, Albin, Oliver Campground, Oliver Reservoir and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 398 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 17. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Expect rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Motorists are urged to use extreme caution if traveling through these areas! Roads may suddenly become icy. Take extra precautions by slowing down and increasing the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you.
